caption: Place has seen better days. It's a relatively expensive "museum" when you consider what it has to offer. Ticket includes a small glass of wine which on the day of our visit was not particularly good. Overall we expected much more in a country and city with an amazing wine heritage. Overall a huge disappointment.
Excellent place overall: friendly staff, delicious food and drinks, cozy place, this is my favorite restaurant so far! 100% recommended.
Nice location and truly educational. Plus you can browse the exhibition with a glass of wine in hand! Audio guides included.

We went for lunch here last Friday. What a fantastic experience! The service, is immediately wonderful. We had the lovely Corentine wait on our table. So friendly. The starters of foie gras and the crab/avocado were delicious. The lamb and onglet de boeuf... excellent. The truffle dauphinois, sublime. We finished with cheese and the pistachio, raspberry, cream dessert. Delicious. We will be going back very soon. Highly recommend

The restaurant in this Wine Museum is a hidden gem. I had the full course lunch with cheese and wine, food was fantastic paired with good wine.  Emmanuel was friendly and introduced us the various wine regions in France and their grapes. It‚Äôs such an amazing experience to dine in a 14th century wine cellar, a must if you come to Paris.
Amazing menu for reasonable price (for Paris)! Fantastic service, very cool location and the best lamb I‚Äôve ever eaten. Not to be missed!

What an amazing experience! Unlike the more touristy wine tasting classes, Emmanuel let us choose the wines we wanted to taste from their extensive wine cellar, and even purchase them. He was so friendly, knowledgeable and patient, and his English was fantastic. Especially when you consider the myriad technical terms and wine making techniques he needed to use to answer our endless questions! Reservations were easy- you just have to email (they don't have it available online). Marie Elise took extra time to helped us package up our wine securely, so it could travel home in our suitcases. She was so kind, and a delight to talk with, and was able to make further wine recommendations based on our tasting. And you get to tour the museum with an audio guide. It was quirky, we learned a lot, and it winds through the ancient wine caves. Thank you so much, we had an amazing experience!

With a large group of around 16 people we had lunch at 49 euros per head, starter, main dish, cheese and dessert.  The good wine (white, red and dessert wine) kept coming and we all had more than enough. Bread was yummy and crunchy.  Staff were very attentive.

This place was a little difficult to find.  Once there the staff welcomed us just before opening.  Lunch was delicious and the wines were great.  Staff speaks limited English but that didn't cause any problems.  Popular with the locals so make a reservation.

Very difficult place to locate. It's hidden back behind large wrought iron gates in an out-of-the-way location.  Caves themselves are intriguing visually and the story is fascinating. However, the museum itself was a little boring. It looked like a collection of flea market finds. Also, if they want to attract international visitors, they should have the signage in more than one language. The audio set was helpful though. Nice stop on a rainy day.

If you book a wine tasting course, make sure to send a follow-up email specifying English if you don't speak French. We showed up for our wine tasting course and were told it wouldn't be a problem for the instructor to accommodate our English request as we understood little French. When the course started, it took only moments for us to be excluded. The instructor would speak for 3-5mins in French and then turn to us and ask if we understood, or simply summarize it in 1 sentence and move on. There were many insults made about us (in French to the group), and when the instructor made a racist comment about us, it was time to leave. The instructor made one last jab at us as we left the tasting course.  On our way out, Yoan assisted us, and quickly came up with a solution. He explained that his English wasn't the best, but if we wanted, we could proceed with a private wine tasting with him in English. We agreed, and our experience changed almost instantly. Yoan turned our unpleasant experience into something amazing. His English was not a problem for us. He was knowledgeable, patient, informative, and full of real-world tips about wine.  It was a sensational experience.  If not for Yoan, this would be a 1* review. If we had Yoan from the start, it would be a 5* review.  We would recommend this experience, but ask for Yoan.  **Edited date visited and added proof of purchase for owner.

The museum itself is a little dull but the tasting afterwards was worth it! Our sommelier helped us understand what we were tasting and how to identify certain notes in ways we would have never thought of! Would absolutely recommend

As a museum, this place is almost not worth a visit unless you have too much free time during your visit in Paris. I am glad I was here for an event. For that purpose the caves and the hidden location offer a very different experience than if simply going to a restaurant

We were there at a company event for wine and cheese tasting. The somelier was very friendly and helped the team interact. The wine and cheese was great and the baguettes kept coming in. Then we had a tour of the museum followed by a delicious meal. The location is great and you can take a stroll by the Eiffel tower, in about 5 minutes. Highly recommended!

We held a team-building meeting here, and the owners arranged for a small meeting space in the restaurant.  After the meeting, we had a delicious meal followed by a wine-tasting challenge to see who could place the wines with their regions.  This is a great place for small get-togethers, and the meal and wine were good.
I've been here several times, it's a staple on our Paris visits. Very cool way to spend a couple of hours. Not usually too crowded and the wind and cheese tasting at the end are a brilliant finish.

Hidden gem in the 16th distrikt, where you need to take your time to wonder around slowly reading the many informations and looking at the rich collection of large and many tiny objects. My favorite part was the ticket with the glass of wine and the President of the association who explained and took time to speak to us at the end of the visit. Wondering in the tunnels once quarries along the Seine is like a travel in history, although I would say it is not a very commercial museum, it is small and private and you need to take your time here. You can buy wines from 12 euro to 1900 euro and they also do wine tasting courses we saw going on in one of the vaults. The courtyard outside the museum is so Paris like and just a beauty to the eyes. Very kind people at the entrance, which makes all the difference.

I'm sure the content of the museum was thoughtfully put together, but the audio guides we received wouldn't stay on more than a few minutes and the front desk repeately insisted they were fine.  The exibits are full of awkward wax figures, and the real highlight was the collection of inappropriate bottle openers.  At the end we received a glass of wine, which was much needed.  Not an experience I would recommend.
The tour includes a free glass of wine, but you will want to try more after watching and hearing everything that Le Musee du Vin has to offer.
Definitely my favourite wine museum in Bordeaux. Lovely experience with the wine tasting which you only get from independent businesses.

I went here when I was 20. My favorite part of the museum is not only the tasting but also how Napoleon used to sneak through an underground tunnel late at night when he couldn't sleep. He would have some wine to help him sleep.
Nothing special. We wanted to do the wine tasting as well. But the personal apparently did not understand us. We were given just a glass of wine that goes with the museum entrance ticket.
Interesting place, small and great, The nice lady there explained about the wine and recommended two great ones. Super fun winter date place in Paris, or just a fun afternoon with friends in paris
Very unique visit in Paris! The wine tastiing is highly recommended, the ≈ìnologues there will help you find a wine to your taste!
Descriptions aren't in english but you can listen to the audio handset. The tasting isn't anything spectacular but they have lots of historic wine equipment and memorabilia.

I drank a glass of wine after seeing around with 13EUR. Sommelier introduces the wine that is good wine from bordeaux at 2008. However it is 'Bouchonne'. I smells vinegar from the wine. Sommelier tolds me that it is for old vintage. It's ridiculous. As I know that wines doesn't have vinegar smell at most 2008 vintage. I don't know that he doesn't know 'Bouchonne' or not. Anyway I could get back other wine (2009) after several complaint and it has an expected Bordeaux smell. I will never go again.
Great place, very romantic to have a lunch, which was great. Best lamb I had for an eternity. Will come back!

Typical place for company event. Very good location outside. Inside it‚Äôs terrible as, it becomes really hot and not ventilated. Food was nothing more than basic, wine tasting was nothing more than a joke. Staff was ok.

I struggle to give it two stars. There was no organization, not chronologically or numerically. It was very confusing. I paid attention the whole time and tried to learn but I can't say I left with any enlightening information. The one free wine tasting wasn't anything to write home about either.
Highly recommended museum, perfect for wine lovers (but not only üôÇ), great place. Monique the wine educator is the best! ‚Ä¶
Interesting to spend a coupe of hours I Paris studying French wine history and finishing it off with a glad of rather rare French wine. Price worth!
Great place with all kinds of wine making instruments throughout the ages. The owners were so fantastic!
Great experience in a beautiful cellar and a wonderful wine and cheese tasting
Fairly expensive for such a short visit. Displays and explanation could be improved in my opinion
13 euro to walk through a musky mannequin display and drink one glass of a 6 euro bottle of wine.
Just the ambiance and the nice location is one star worth, the rest is not my style (food, wine and coffee)
Great food and fantastic wine, highly recommend
Lot's of winemaking artifacts. Glass of wine was not a full pour and quite floral.
